page.title: 02 TRANSPORT IN WEEDON
page.content: We discovered that most people in Weedon use a motor-car as their means of transport.People without cars use the bus service.Among the younger people motor-cycles are the most popular. The buses that call at Weedon run to Daventry and Northampton.Sometimes they run to Milton Keynes. There is no coach station in the village,the only coaches that come regularly are school coaches.The school coaches take us swimming in Daventry,or on visits to museums or other interesting places. When I asked my dad he said he wanted a Porsche.The newest car of 1985 is the Sinclair C5 which runs on electricity. Britain's first motorway,the M1,runs close to the village.
